intro: Barbeya oleoides subsp. arussorum, commonly known as the Armenian barberry, is a shrub native to the Caucasus region. It is characterized by its thorny stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. The plant produces bright orange-red berries that are edible but have a tart flavor. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable species in the genus Barbeya.
